config.title: Default Prettier configuration
config.description: Used for remote files or if no Prettier configuration file exists. Can be overridden in project settings.

children.title: Print width
children.description: Specify the line length that the printer will wrap on.

children.title: Tab width
children.description: Specify the number of spaces per indentation-level.

children.title: Use tabs
children.description: Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces.

children.title: Use semicolons
children.description: Print semicolons at the ends of statements.

children.title: Use single quotes
children.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes.

children.title: Quote props
children.description: Change when properties in objects are quoted.

children.title: Use single quotes in JSX
children.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes in JSX.

children.title: Trailing commas
children.description: Print trailing commas wherever possible when multi-line. (A single-line array, for example, never gets trailing commas.)

children.title: Use bracket spacing
children.description: Print spaces between brackets in object literals.

children.title: Use same-line JSX brackets
children.description: Put the > of a multi-line JSX element at the end of the last line instead of being alone on the next line (does not apply to self closing elements).

children.title: Arrow function parentheses
children.description: Include parentheses around a sole arrow function parameter.

children.title: Require pragma
children.description: Prettier can restrict itself to only format files that contain a special comment, called a pragma, at the top of the file. This is very useful when gradually transitioning large, unformatted codebases to prettier.

children.title: Insert pragma
children.description: Prettier can insert a special @format marker at the top of files specifying that the file has been formatted with prettier. This works well when used in tandem with the --require-pragma option. If there is already a docblock at the top of the file then this option will add a newline to it with the @format marker.

children.title: Prose wrap
children.description: By default, Prettier will wrap markdown text as-is since some services use a linebreak-sensitive renderer, e.g. GitHub comment and BitBucket. In some cases you may want to rely on editor/viewer soft wrapping instead, so this option allows you to opt out with "never".

children.title: HTML whitespace sensitivity
children.description: Specify the global whitespace sensitivity for HTML files, see Prettier documentation formatting for more info.

children.title: Ident vue file script and style tags
children.description: Whether or not to indent the code inside <script> and <style> tags in Vue files. Some people (like the creator of Vue) don’t indent to save an indentation level, but this might break code folding in your editor.

children.title: Format documents when saved
children.description: Can be overridden in project settings.

children.title: Ignore documents without Prettier configuration file
children.description: Can be overridden in project settings.

children.title: Ignore remote documents
children.description: Can be overridden in project settings.

children.title: Ignored syntaxes
children.description: Documents set to an ignored syntax will never be formatted when saved

children.title: Log debug information to Extension Console
